intro: Veronica capsellicarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved speedwell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, typical of the Veronica genus. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and drought-tolerant landscaping.
